article.headline: S. Utah 68, Oakland, Mich. 59
article.story: CEDAR CITY, Utah (AP) -- Geoff Payne had 19 points and 13 rebounds to lead Southern Utah to a 68-59 victory over Oakland on Thursday. Tyler Quinney scored 16 points for the Thunderbirds (10-18, 8-9 Summit), who have won five of their last six games. Orlando Griego added 10 points. Johnathon Jones led the Golden Grizzlies (15-13, 10-7) with 23 points, while Erik Kangas scored 16 points, all in the second half. Payne, the reigning Summit League player of the week, registered his sixth double-double of the season. The Thunderbirds were outrebounded 38-28, but they committed seven turnovers while forcing 19. Southern Utah, which shot 57 percent in the second half, never trailed. The T-Birds biggest lead came on Payne's free throw that made it 23-12 with 4:09 left in the first half. Oakland cut the lead to 63-57 on Kangas 3-pointer with 1:01 remaining, but Southern Utah went 9-for-10 from the foul line in the final minute to clinch it.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
